Review Text: These are the best overnight and extra heavy flow pads by far. In a perfect world, I could get by using only period panties, but the first 2-3 days are way too heavy for period panties available on the market (I haven't tried the disposable ones yet). I also tend to leak on the front instead of the back, which 99% of pads and period panties are made for. Due to their length, these work well, especially if you wear them backwards. Because of their size and thickness, they aren't the most comfortable if you're being active.

Review Text: I needed a pad for a temporary bladder leakage and since the old type pads that were used with a sanitary belt (yep, I'm that old) haven't been made in decades and would be the ideal resolution, I went looking for something that would suffice for small bladder leakage problems. Since I used to use Always products years ago, and after researching several pad options, I thought this would be a great way to protect my clothing should an instance occur. Well, when I opened the package and opened one of the pads I was really surprised. These pads are huge in length, but are good in width. except that I have to cut off the bottom 2 inches of the pad at the fold when you open it unless you want to use it for night time urine protection. I bought these for the thickness and for the "wings" but the only problem is that there is virtually little to no adhesion! I have to use a small safety pin in the front to attach the pad to my underware. Kind of defeats the purpose. For now, they will suffice. Should I need to order this type of pad again, I would not buy these Always and would look for something else. It's a shame because if it were not for the lack of adhesion and the length, these would be perfect.
Product Name: Always Maxi Overnight Extra Heavy Flow with Wings, Unscented Pads 27 Count (Jumbo)

Review Text: These pads are so comfortable and I love them but the package I received this time has very poor adhesive, so they fall off my underwear every time I pull them up after using the bathroom. Also this package, after wearing the pad for about 2 hours I went to the bathroom and when I pulled my pants down there was cotton all over the place and a hole in the back of the pad. The same thing happened with my size 3 pads so I'm not sure if the quality went down or this is a coincidence that two different size pads of the same brand have the same problems. Other brands like from Amazon and Walmart have much better adhesive and do not tear but are not quite as comfortable, they are less thick and soft.

Review Text: Just as how other reviewers said, this pad is very very thick and long, which helps me through my heavy flow during sleep. It wraps around that I never experienced any leaks and it is also very comfortable. However, it's so thick and long that I can only use this at night. I only gave it a 4 because it's very confusing to buyers that Always have maxi and ultra thin for size 5 but they perform very differently. Review Text: Having suffered from very heavy periods for years, using two pads at a time or a tampon and a pad, having to change every hour because I have bled through my clothes, not sleeping well because I have to change my pad every time, I must say these are a godsend. Day 2 and 3 of my periods are the heaviest and I am just annoyed that I did not find this pad much earlier. Now I can sleep through most of the night and don't have to plan my life to a 'T' around my bloody period (pardon the pun).They are very long and bulky (but I don't find them uncomfortable) so would be visible through tight fitting clothes. However, I would take these any day over having to change every hour and bleeding through clothes and the mess that comes with it. I just wear long tops or really loose fitting clothes so they are not visible.

Review Text: I recently relocated to the UK from Canada. I used to buy these all the time in Canada as you can find them in Canadian stores and they are inexpensive. Why the hell can't you find these in UK stores? I thought brexit was bad but this is just nonsense. I have endometriosis and large uterine fibroids and as a result have heavy periods . I wear these at night or on long car rides/ flight as it's the only thing that protects my clothes and bedding unlike the crepe thin crap pads sold in U.K markets. Had I'd known that I would not find these pads here then I would have bought a suitcase of these across the border. And for the low reviews and people complaining about that it's not good for incontinence issues - Jesus - buy the appropriate pads for that. Bad enough that I had to come to Amazon to buy women's sanitary pads. This is a new low in U.K history.

Review Text: I hate that I have to write a negative review for a product I've used and never used to have issues with for years, I've been using this brand since I first got my period over 10 years ago and I never used to have a problem but ever since they updated the design/formula I've been having more leakage and problems ever since. It feels like a cheap copy of the product I used to love.As someone who has always experienced period anxiety the change in these pads makes it so much worse, I feel like I'm going through pads more often because I don't feel the secureness I used to. So much for the leak guard I've leaked or almost leaked through more of these new pads than I've ever done in my entire life & especially at night!, I don't know what exactly is going on with the wings but I feel like that is half the problem and leakage from the side is more than likely to happen. Along with this god awful new design at the bottom and top of the pads where the pad itself (the absorbant part) is no longer rounded ???? Who thought that was a good idea?!?! This also restricts people on the way that they can wear them I know many people including myself that have worn them backwards/upside down/the wrong way up in the past for whatever reason because why would I want what should be the bottom end at the top because there's a like split in it ???? and the other end is pointed like WHY??? It feels like there's less of a pad because of it!I also have had issues with the stickiness of the pads themselves, the wings hardly stick at all and the pad itself is either too sticky or not sticky enough. Literally what is going on ??? The fact I've been using this new formula for months and it's gotten to the point I've had to write a review really says everything.I swear every time I buy a new packet the amount I get is less and less (started with 32 then 24 and now 22!!), I know this is captalism but like with the quality change and the fact I feel like I'm going through more pads because of it because I don't feel safe to last as long as I usually word because the leak guard isn't as good it's a joke. My period isn't getting shorter or lighter by you putting less pads in a packet. Bring back the 32 pack that was great amount for me personally, 22 isn't enough! I know it shouldn't matter given the fact I'm getting 4 boxes of 22 pads but I used to be able to go through only 1 packet of 32 per period now because of the quality change & drop in pads I'm going through almost 1 and 1/2 to almost instead. At the same price!Literally the only reason my rating isn't lower is because I do still use them and I do have somewhat a decent experience despite all this, being able to buy a multipack of 4 is a great thing and I feel like saves money in the long run, and I still do find them comfortable (for a pad) given my sensory issues. It's just a shame that they decided to change something (or a lot of things really) that didn't really need fixing. & I've heard it's not just the ultra pads that have these issues it's most if not all the other versions of always pads.

Review Text: Tried these a couple of cycles ago for the first time & won't be going back to my previous big brand products. These are soft, comfortable, no soreness/rubbing or any kind of irritation, all things I'd sadly accepted as unavoidable until finding these. They make no rustling noises & you can barely feel you're wearing a pad. Yes they need changing a little more frequently but I find they absorb so much better than any other brand I've ever tried. No leaks so far even on heavy flow days. So pleased to see this product in my local supermarkets too. I've tried the day & night ones & definitely find these night ones a better size, day ones for me personally are suitable only for really light flow days. Absolutely no regrets in giving this product a try

Review Text: I'm so amazed at these pads, I was hesitant when opening the box as the pads are super thin so wasn't expecting much, however was very pleasantly surprised! They are so absorbent and I had no leaks despite me worrying about the thickness. This is also one of the first pads that actually sticks properly and stays put which is usually an issue - its not fun having a sticky wing sticking to sensitive parts! They're also so soft against the skin, its feels so comfortable and doesn't make the dreaded rustling nappy noise when you walk! As its super thin, you can barely even feel it, with different brands you're always aware of the chunky pad, this one is magic! Don't hesitate to give these a go, like me im sure you'll be very pleasantly surprised! I will be purchasing these from now on, no more leaks or discomfort!

Review Text: These Flo Bamboo Night Pads are honestly a lifesaver !They are super absorbent yet thin, soft and breathable, and they don't cause any of the irritation or itchiness.I usually get it with the regular commercial ones so that's why I tried a different one and this brand is Wow !The wings keep them secure, they feel gentle against the skin, and they make nights comfortable without the usual chemicals we can find on most popular brands.Sure, they're a bit pricier and not stocked everywhere, but let's face it: I'd rather pay extra for comfort than keep pretending that tossing and turning all night counts as cardio!

Review Text: These pads are impressively absorbent and offer excellent overnight protection. They're huge, which is perfect for heavy flow, and the organic cotton feels soft and comfortable. I really appreciate the hypoallergenic and vegan-friendly formula.The back wings are wide and secure, but the front wings could be longer to help the pad stick better and offer more coverage. That's the only reason I've given four stars instead of five. Otherwise, they're a brilliant product and very reliable.

Review Text: The Real-World ContextFor those of us with exceptionally heavy cycles or who work demanding shift patterns, disposable products are a necessity. On my heaviest days, I frequently "double up" on solutions to stay secure. As a UK customer, my main go-to is usually Daye, but Flo has become a vital part of my routine because of its accessibility. While mail-order brands can take days, I can get Flo next-day on Amazon Prime. This was a lifesaver during the recent 2025 festive period when I forgot my mail order and was too unwell with the flu to leave the house. It's also reassuring to know they are widely available locally at Boots, Superdrug, or Tesco in a pinch.Reduced Sensitivity & PerformanceSkin Comfort: Since switching to these, I have noticed significantly reduced sensitivity and irritation. I believe the naturally absorbent qualities of bamboo viscose are the key; they draw blood away from the skin in under a minute without the use of harsh chemicals.The "Shift Worker" Test: If you are on an 8--12 hour shift, the breathability of the Oeko-Tex organic bamboo is a game-changer. It prevents that "damp" or "sweaty" feeling common with plastic-based pads.Exercise & Odour: The bamboo provides natural odour control that actually works during workouts, all without the chemicals that can trigger my skin sensitivity.Thin & Discreet: These are slim enough to stay hidden under tight leggings while still handling a heavy flow as effectively as an Always Night pad.Privacy: A small but important detail - the plant-starch wrappers are very quiet to open, which is great for privacy in shared or workplace bathrooms.The Critical Bit (Fit & Adhesive)The "Double Wings" are a good concept, but the adhesive isn't quite as aggressive as mainstream plastic brands. I've found these stick very well to the inside of period pants, but they can struggle with "silky" synthetic underwear. If you're active or working a long shift, I highly recommend pairing them with cotton or bamboo-based briefs to ensure they stay centred.Sustainability & Ethics (Without the Guilt)Living in Scotland, I often feel a lot of "eco-guilt" due to government messaging regarding disposable period products. Buying from a female-founded, BCorp Certified brand helps ease that.Eco-Specs: They are 87% plant-based and PETA-certified vegan.Disposal: The wrappers are home-compostable, and while the pads go in general waste, they are biodegradable in landfill conditions.Bottom LineA high-performance, skin-friendly bridge for those who need the reliability of a disposable but want to support an ethical business. They keep you dry, fresh, and irritation-free even on your toughest days.

Review Text: Super soft and gentle sanitary protection these are my favourite gentle pads to use unfortunately when it's heavy days I don't feel that they would offer the best protection although I haven't leaked through I don't want to risk itThe pads after a little while start to fray and come apart around the edges I change regularly every time I go to the bathroom so it hasn't been in place for that long and sometimes I'm left with pieces of the pad coming apart that being said I still think these are super softI also have sensitive skin and some of the cheap plastic pads would irritate my skin these have helped after using heavy flow or tampons when required I have been able to switch to these to ease any discomfort4/5 stars due to them coming apart

Review Text: For me, the design of these pads is pure perfection. They have every quality that I could ever want in a pad. They are exceptionally comfortable, provide excellent absorption and fit perfectly. They are a lot more expensive that the pads I usually buy, however they are a quality product, made with good quality materials and I believe they are worth the extra cost.They truly feel like a product designed by women, for women, from the way they look and feel, right down to the tiny details. I would absolutely recommend to anyone considering giving them a go, you're unlikely to be disappointed.

Review Text: These are absolutely brilliant.They're much more comfortable and functional than the leading brand.I've been looking for something I can wear that keeps me feeling warm and dry all night long / during work in the day and these are great, thank you.(The new type of Always are terrible at the moment, I have to get up in the night to change pads and they feel wet, cold and uncomfortable in the day.)My one suggestion would be to make it long both sides - front and back - for those of us who are curvy, or sleep on our front.Thank you x

Review Text: It's my first time using these pads. I was looking for something more eco friendly than my usual store pads, no chemicals or something harsh.Unfortunately, although they are presented as super absorbent, for me they didn't work.In my second day of menstrual cycle (usually high flow) they just didn't absorbed and we are talking about a couple of hours.I won't recommend them for a high flow.I am going with 5 stars because I don't want to ruin anyone s business. But I just wanted to inform everyone who is looking for super absorbent pads and eco friendly in the same time that they won't fulfil your wish having a high flow like me.

Review Text: This is my fourth time purchasing Rael Organic Cotton Cover Sanitary Towels, and I keep coming back for a reason. I buy these for my wife, and she has consistently told me that they are noticeably more comfortable than other brands she has tried.The organic cotton cover feels soft and gentle on the skin, with no irritation at all. The pads are ultra thin but still offer reliable absorbency, so they feel light and breathable while providing enough protection for everyday use. She also really appreciates that they are unscented and hypoallergenic, which makes a big difference for sensitive skin.Overall, the comfort, quality, and peace of mind make these pads well worth it for us. We're very satisfied and will definitely continue purchasing. Highly recommended --- five stars without hesitation.

Review Text: Quite an expensive product, but you get what you pay for in this instance and worth every penny! My daughter has very heavy periods for the first couple of days before they trail off to a more acceptable level and would always bleed though her clothing using high street brands despite using the most absorbent pads out there. It's not always possible to go to change your pad every hour and she couldn't get on with tampons. Since she has started using these pads she is more confident in leaving the house during her period as they are much more absorbent than anything else she has tried. Also I pleased that they are chemical free.

Review Text: Why has nobody ever thought of making these before-they are PERFECT-!!!! I am a 'young 50 year old' lol and thought I would try these as I even struggled to get Tampax during lockdown-pffftttt. Previously used Tampax/supermarket own brand tampons since being a teen-these are an absolute godsend because they are perfectly sized for us petite ladies, very comfortable and NOT visible at all-!! Work the same as big ones but no bulk, no more rubbing side of legs (I always suffered this-hence the TP's), completely invisible under tight trousers/jeans & not feeling like you're wearing a nappy-eek-!! (Only gripe is that the adhesive isn't really the strongest but that's about it-!!)

Review Text: I love the Mooncup brand and regularly use their cups, but sometimes I prefer wearing a pad, so I was eager to try these. Unfortunately, they weren't the right fit for me.The main issue was comfort, I found the pads a little too stiff and not as flexible as I like. I was very conscious of the fact I was wearing one, which I don't like. I kept checking mirrors to make sure it wasn't visible! The wings were also a downside. While fairly adhesive, they were small and didn't stay in place as well as I'd hoped.That said, the absorbency was great, and I experienced no leakage, so they do work well in that regard. They just weren't comfortable for me personally.

Review Text: These pads are really nice. I found them quite interesting at first as the centre rectangle on the pad was quite stiff/ hard and it felt thick. It did get softer after a while which was nice and it is well absorbing. The sizing is also pretty nice - they looked/ felt a tiny bit wider than the ones I usually use but they cover my underwear well so the sizing has definitely been thought out super well. I usually do not like wings, but these ones seem well crafted. They do not bug me or my thighs, stick well and stay nicely in shape. I would definitely purchase these again as the experience of using them has been highly positive!

Review Text: Used for a second month now. No problems at all. On my heaviest day I've worn a tampon for part of the day but to be honest that was 'just in case', I think next month I won't bother. I've got 2 packs of the largest size, a pack of medium and one pack of light. Plenty to get through the 5/6 days for me 😊.I rinse them until the water pretty much runs clear and they then either go straight in a wash or in a wet bag until I put a wash on. Yes you have to rinse and squeeze out blood which on heavy days isn't the most pleasant job but it really doesn't take long. So worth it for the comfort and massive reduction in plastic waste!They definitely absorb more than even the biggest disposable pad. Almost makes your flow appear lighter.They don't leak and are easy to use out and about with the wet bag.If you're at all sceptical then just wear them in the house at first to get used to them, and if you're worried when using themOut the house for the first time, either combine with tampons initially or just bring disposables as back ups.I don't think you'll regret giving them a go.Just make sure you have good fitting underwear when wearing the smaller pads as they can move around a bit.

Review Text: Purchased these sanitary pads as was looking for something comfortable and to stop buying disposable pads. The pretty dark design is nice and discreet and they fit into panties well and secure easily in place with the popper. Like the little bag to store them in until they are ready to be washed, as keeps odours and mess at bay. The pads are easy to clean, just rinse and then put them in the washing machine. These pads are fine for light to medium days, but found they are not great for heavy flow as advertised, as they are a bit short in length and not wide enough which causes pad to leak slightly. Also for particularly heavy flow they could definitely benefit from being longer in length and wider at the back to save any leakages. Will look to buy some more reusable pads which are longer and wider for those heavier days and nights. Overall happy with purchase. Nice pads of good value and quality.

Review Text: Ladies, please go for this. Not only has it completely reduced my use of tampos and pads, of which are very bad for the environment, I no longer get the skin rashes that normally come with the pads that most often aren't talked about.It does to be fair feel like a cinder block in your pants at first (though this does not mean they are uncomfortable by any mean, they are just noticeably thicker and bigger than pads) because it is very thick but it gets the job done and there are medium strength ones anyways so to each their own. Rest assured when you sleep, no matter what position you pull, blood will not escape this beast. 100% very good purchase, will be buying more.My recommendation if you get heavy flow regularly on periods, go for the heavy flow one as it really can capture all of your waste. I also wear it outside of period to catch discharge because it's just that comfortable to wear and protects my sensitive skin from non-cotton underwear at times and chafing.

Review Text: This pack of 6 lasted me from the afternoon of day 1 to the evening of day 2, which is about the same as disposables for me. The fleecy upper material is soft and very comfortable, and I didn't find them bulky at all. Absorbency seems good, but perhaps not as quick to wick away wetness. I did notice a slight smell, I suspect the chemicals in disposable pads usually control this. No problems with leaking or moving.I used these 6 pads, then switched back to disposables whilst I set about washing them. I put them in a plastic bathroom bin and rinsed with cold water. I'm not squeamish but I did find this a little unpleasant. Then in the washing machine on 40 degrees for an hour, with normal detergent. They air dry quickly. I put them in with the bath mat, I didn't fancy mixing with clothes.On the whole a positive experience. I will give another cycle's trial before I purchase another set of 6. Main negatives for me are the rinsing (I may try skipping this step), smell (natural but slightly unpleasant) and not being able to monitor how much I'm bleeding (difficult to see or tell).

Review Text: I was a bit hesitant making the move from disposables to reusables, but based on previous reviews I decided to give Eco Lily a go. I purchased one pack in my first order (3x large & 3x medium), which were so good that I immediately ordered another 6x medium & 6x light pads. The large and medium are very good, super absorbent and very comfortable. They fit and stay in place perfectly and hold a lot more than disposable pads. I am a lot more confident wearing these cloth pads that haven't leaked once, (compared to disposables that would leak on occasion and you'd often feel like you to need pop to the bathroom to 'go and check'). The first time I wore one I thought it felt a bit bulkier than a disposable, but I very soon got used to it and decided that I preferred this extra feeling of comfort and confidence that I was well covered anyway.That said, the small/light pads are not as good. They are still very absorbent, but they do not stay in place as well as the medium/large. Probably because they are smaller and have less 'bulk/length' behind them to stop them sliding up/down your underwear with just the popper behind it. I did have to keep pulling it up every time I went to the bathroom. I have decided to use the large/medium most of the time and only use the light for the last very light day as just a back-up. But honestly, if you are considering reusable cloth pads then Eco Lily large/medium is a great option.

Review Text: I got a package of 3 large, and 3 medium and honesty I did not take out a ruler to visualize the size before purchase... but I was a bit shocked about the large-sized ones. They are ENOURMOUS and I don't consider them fit to wear during the day with normal trousers. I use them at night now. In terms of absorbency, I was really positively surprised. The surface looks and feels like a soft fleece sweater (is therefore very comfortable on the skin and feels MUCH nicer than common throw-away large pads surface) which I did not expect to take in liquid so well. I was sceptical at first but felt absolutely safe the second time wearing them. I rinsed them cold and washed them at 30 degrees then and they come out as new.

Review Text: I just had to write a review about these sanitary pads, they are truly life changing. I didn't expect them to be as good as they are and so felt it necessary to write an in depth review.These arrived well packaged and I ordered 6 of the heavy flow pads as I tend to have two or three very heavy days.I was very impressed at how these pads kept me dry and comfortable during very heavy days. I used to use the disposable pads which had an annoying floral smell which impregnated my underwear. I hated it. These pads have no odour at all, even when saturated. They are soft and warm, but on a hot day, do not make you feel sweaty or uncomfortable.The pads are fleecy, and very easy to clean. I just ran under cold water immediately after removing it, and then once the water runs clear, I switched to warm water, used a little castille soap and washed the whole pad by hand. Then I wrung it out and left to air on an airer.I'm not squeamish about blood, so you may want to put in the washing machine, but they are so easy to clean by hand.They seem well made, the stitching is very nice and the material is good quality.Overall, I'm really happy to have found these. I'm putting less plastic into the environment and spending less overall too. Win win!

Review Text: I have been thinking of trying a reusable pad for some time but was totally clueless which brand to try. I can across these whilst isolating having got covid. My time of the month happened earlier than expected and I kept forgetting to add some sanitary towels to my supermarket delivery. I ordered these on Amazon as they had next day delivery and I was about to run out. When they arrived, I was a bit anxious about a reusable pad but then thought it is no different to a Terry type nappy we wore as babies so would be fine. I gave it a try thinking I was not leaving home for a while so could quickly shower if there was a problem with leakage. However, I was extremely surprised how absorbent the pad was. It also felt soft, warm and fluffy rather than the horrible cold plastic which often makes you feel sore. The pads are easy to clean and I will probably invest in some more next month so I have 2 sets to use. I wish I had found this product years ago. Looking forward to saving money in the future and helping to save the planet.

Review Text: So if you're like me, and disposible sanitary pads irritate your body, make you feel uncomfortable, and make you feel a wee bit gross when wearing them, 100% give these a shot!I've just finished my first cycle using them and I'm never going back to disposable pads. These are comfortable, they stay in place. Super soft and fleecy material, that seems to absorb everything. I got longer between changing pads with these which was ideal for my 8 hour shift. Theres no odor at all. Zero leakage even over night, and I mean nothing! I have very heavy periods so this is a big plus. I didn't feel like I was sweating in them and they didn't crunch up like disposable ones do. They just stayed nice and flat and kept shape.I washed them all as instructed without Fabric conditioner, and they washed well.

Review Text: These are amazing! I wish I'd have bought them sooner. They are so comfortable and beat all my expectations. I didn't think they would be as good as the reviews and adverts were saying but they honestly are. They are super absorbent, you can't tell how full they are while wearing until you rinse them out, so very comfortable. I have really heavy periods but they didn't let me down once. If anything they are so much better than the disposable pads. They are really soft, I used to have a reaction to the disposable ones but these are so gentle. They are easy to use, 2 sets of poppers depending on how tight you need them for different underwear. If you wear big tight underwear they stay in place, you obviously have to wear appropriate underwear for them to stay put. They rinse out really easily and fold up with the poppers to go in the little storage bag until you are ready to wash them properly. They look quite thick as they are soft fleece but once you have got them on you really can't tell. I really wish I'd have tried them out sooner, I wouldn't ever go back to disposable ones again, they are so much better for the environment but for me they are also so much more comfortable, non irritant and I don't need 4 packets for 1 period.

Review Text: Firstly I just want to say I was absolutely appalled at the Prospect of using anything reusable due to having THE WORST periods every month due to adenymyosis and endometriosis. My periods are super heavy.With old pads I would use one every 2 hours. One of these can last me overnight!!!! which is a GOD SEND as previously I would have fo set my alarms to get up and change otherwise it would be a massacre in the morning. ;( Be prepared for them to feel a bit thicker and when you pull your knickers back up after a wee etc make sure you have it sitting right as they aren't sticky they are secured with a popper, but you will learn to remember to do this and it's no hassle at all because you aren't running the toilet every hour or so. They are very easy to clean and look brand new each time they have come out of the wash. Without a doubt the best purchase I've made to date. And that's saying something. If like me you've not wanted to make this jump to reusable... DO IT!! These save me a fortune and genuinely I will never use anything else. ✨✨✨✨

They are very easy to clean and look brand new each time they have come out of the wash. Without a doubt the best purchase I've made to date. And that's saying something. If like me you've not wanted to make this jump to reusable... DO IT!! These save me a fortune and genuinely I will never use anything else. ✨✨✨✨

Review Text: Best I've found for a good price. Never leaked, and really comfortable. I wear with period pants just for the extra protection because I can be super heavy but you don't really need to. Have tried a couple of brands and these are the comfiest and stay in place the best. Have only found them move when I've been realllly wriggly in the night whereas other brands sometimes move just from walking around! Bought my first packet to try during lockdown (2020) and they're still going strong now (2024). Have bought more to replace some I have from a different brand that haven't lasted!

Review Text: I've been trying to make eco-friendlier choices in all aspects of my life and had in the past used organic cotton sanitary pads. But I decided to try the reusable washable pads, even if it was just for the evenings and the heavier days at home.I've been using these and they're great. Unlike normal san-pro - you don't feel any liquid in fact the material draws the blood away from the surface and you feel dry. I've used two towels in a day, much less than I'd use with the ordinary towels.The only minus is that as other reviewers have said, it feels like they need an extra popper underneath and it can feel a bit bulky, but not seriously uncomfortable - perhaps undies which are a bit tighter would be better when wearing these. I don't think I'll be wearing them under my leggings at the gym, but for everyday use, under jeans etc, I wouldn't have a problem.As regards cleaning, it's pretty easy, just rinse them out and wash them without fabric softener. If you've had babies in reusable nappies, you could always soak them in a solution of napisan in a bucket like with the nappies, if you were really worried. They dry pretty quickly on the line, too!All round I'm happy to use these!

Review Text: I wish I bought them much earlier - now used for 3 months.During pandemic/home office I thought it was a good time to try them and I was right.They are super absorbent, stay well in the panty. I worried that the side material is the same as the top, but there is no leakage. Rather thick, but eventually I don't really notice when using.I bought the package with mixed sizes - quite difficult to find the right size, would have been nicer to have a different pattern for different sizes. (or I should get another holder to separate them...)6 pieces may be enough, when using 5 daytime, soak during daytime and wash them in the evening and let them dry by morning. It was enough even during heavy flow, however I would recommend to buy more, you never know...I think the concept of 6 piece is weird - too much to try, too few to use during period without the fear you much wash every night. (finally when I bought more, I washed them every 1,5 days anyways... doesn't sound much different, but it gives you more freedom...)I have bought other manufacturer's cheaper products as well. Those are much thinner, with very same concept.It is true though that Eco Lily has better quality in the top material, also snaps are much easier to handle compare to the other product. However, overall competitor cheaper product is also doing its job. So if price is a large factor, when choosing, you can reconsider...

Review Text: Im new to the reuseable sanitary market and having used these for two cycles now I can completely say without hesitation that I'm a convert.My first 3 days are always very heavy and I must admit on my first cycle I decided to double up with a tampon during a trip to the cinema (I usually soak through a tampon within 2hrs during day 2) as I was fearful of making a terrible mistake and having to deal with leaks on seats and bloody crack marks on my jeans etc. However the rest of my cycles have been a breeze. If anything there is something odly comforting about the fleecy-ness. The same kind of feeling you get in the winter when you step out the bath and throw on a fleece onesie/ dressing gown, only this blanket is for cooch.I bought 2 lingerie wash bag, placed one in my wardrobe with my clean pads and some spare period pants for storage and the other sat inside my laundry bin so that when I throw them in the washing machine their in there together and it's less hassle!I would HIGHLY recommend making the switch ladies. Just try it. Let's normalise periods and encourage sustainability in doing so!!

Review Text: Was not sure whether to purchase these but wanted to reduce the wastage from using disposable pads every month. I am so glad I bought these pads , took a while to get used to . I would suggest some snug fitting stretchy pants as they do move around abit. I like wearing loose fitting underwear but found the pads slid from back to front abit so went out to get some 'snuggier' pants and that solved the problem. The panty liner types are very absorbent . I also bought the medium and large pads for the monthlies and found them to be extremely absorbent, more so than disposable pads . No leakage at all. The sizes would be the same as disposable panty liners/ menstrual pads . I found that I don't need to change them as often as I would if I were using disposable ones. They are easy to clean , I usually give them a rinse when I'm in the shower and throw them into a bucket ready to go into the washing machine. They dry very quickly as well ready for the next use. Have bought a box of six panty liners and a box of three medium and three large pads and found them enough usage for both my daughter and I at this moment . If not I would not hesitate to buy some more. She is absolutely loving them as well , especially the fact that they are saving the planet . In the long run it saves on money and reducing the waste going into landfill sites. If you are unsure I wouldn't hesitate , just buy some and save your purse and the planet ! Also very fast delivery from the seller.

Review Text: Switched to eco pads to try to save money and the planet. I like the waterproof bag for carrying clean/used pads during the day. They are thicker than disposable pads, and do cause more sweating because fabric is thicker. However, is waterproof with minimal slippage. Unfortunately, there is slippage and after some time, smell begins to stick to the fabric, even with rinsing the used one on changing (as per instructions), and washing same day, with two laundry tablets. Had to recently get some disposable back up as still washing these and unfortunately feel I will likely go back as they are more comfortable, don't hold any odd odours, and no slippage at all (with wings).I liked the concept, and they have saved some money over time but the design is not quite there.

Review Text: This is my second set of reusable pads so I knew what to expect, still having a few of the old ones the difference was easy to see immediately. These one are more padded so much softer without being overly thick and they have varying lengths and thickness so it's good for different period days, they're super easy to clean I wash them when I'm in the shower and just hang them to dry and if I'm out the little baggie they come in has two zippers so it's easy to separate the clean ones from the used ones and I put some zip locks in the bag so I can put the used ones in a zip lock first then put them in the second compartment and wash them when I get home. Love everything about them, on day 3 onwards I only have to change once (using only two pads, one during the day one at nights) with no fear of leaking as they absorb quite a bit. On the heavier days I would use the thicker ones of course and could last around 4hrs before I have to change

Review Text: I have really appreciated these as a much better solution to feminine hygiene than conventional disposables. They don't stick painfully to you, don't need endlessly reordering, and are effective and generally really easy to handle.They wear well. I brought some almost three years ago and am only just starting to think about getting a new set. I did have to sew up a loose seam on one shortly after purchase but I have had no other issues with them needing repair or wearing out.The only problem I've had is that they do slide backwards and forwards in looser fitting underwear. On the whole, however, I would have said I have had less leaking with these than using disposables: they scrunch up less and have good absorbancy.To launder them, I generally put them through a low temperature delicates' wash without any sort of soap or other product (not because they are delicate, but for the clean cold water soak), and then I wash them again at 40C with my cottons (and my ordinary washing detergent). They have been quite happy with this treatment and look totally unused - no staining or unsavoury smell or anything - when it is finished.Given that they are durable and don't need a lot of elaborate or high temperature cleaning, they are almost certainly more ecological than disposables in the vast majority of circumstances. Which in this case, is just the cherry on the cake!

Review Text: I have had these in my basket for so long, and just kept putting off buying them because I've never used reusable sanitary products before, but I have issues with lots of main stream products and finally got fed up and made an order.Initially the price seemed steep compared to a pack of towels, but obviously they're the only ones you'll need now for (I don't know how long? ) a good while I think, if not forever? So I got over that and just went for it.They have been nothing short of life changing. No crinkly noises when you're walking, no bunching up and causing unwanted problems, so so comfortable to wear, no smell, no leaking, list goes on.My only con if I had to have one, is obviously you have to physically wash them which can take a bit of getting used to, but that's definitely not a negative to the product. I have been rinsing mine through in cold water in the bathroom sink until the water is clear ish, and then putting them into a laundry bag and washing on 30 and have had no issues at all, they come out perfectly clean, no stains and no smell.Honestly if you're unsure like I was, definitely go for it, they're amazing.

Review Text: Many years of adding to landfill via monthly cycle, I decided to try these.Heavy menstrual bleeding is in the eye of the beholder to be honest, but I'm hurtling towards "that" age where they get sh**ter than they ever were. These can cope-ish on a rough day, but tbh that would be asking a lot of any product. I think they could be more secure- it would be greatly appreciated if there was a little product development in the way they secure to underwear. No one wants STs spinning around in their pants when they go to the toilet, they have to stay the right way up and in place otherwise, dignity lost.Took me a day to get used to carrying the dirty ones in the very discreet waterproof bag. They washed clean on low temps and worked exactly the same after.Pros- less waste, better for the Earth, non-perfumed and soft, they will cope with average/normal menstrual bleeding I'm sure. Menorrhagia on a bad day? Not so convinced. They wash well, the bag is waterproof. There is no scent, there's no smell when in use either.Cons- it takes a while to get used to the change, it takes a while to build faith, they're thick, they are secured in the middle with one press stud- it needs more (I'm not sure how you'd achieve that though, but that's why I don't work in product development).Give them a go.

Review Text: It took a bit of courage to swap on to these, they aren't cheap for what they are but they are worth it. I had a few concerns buying these;Would they stay in the right position without sticky wings? Yes they do, and are more comfortable as a result, they naturally rest in the right place, no more leaks from placing it 2cm too far forward or back.Would the bulk of the fabric feel weird? They are a bit bigger than single use towels, however that is forgotten in seconds, because they are not as ridged as single use ones, they form around your body so it's not restrictive in the same way as using bigger single use products.Would they be as absorbent? I did a lot of research these came the top of a few lists for best absorbency, I'm not disappointed.Would the pack size be enough? For me, the smaller ones cover the day, and the larger for night, on a cold radiator with hand washing they are drying in a day and I use max 3 per day.Would they be prone to leaks? Not so far, actually because there fabric moulds around my body, I have had less leaks.Some report say they smell more than single use towels? If you use a scented towel, then yes you might notice a difference, I react to scented products so only ever use plain, i would say they are better than unscented single use.Would they feel a bit clammy or soggy, or heavy without the tech of lightweight single use towels? Nope, they are fine, I haven't felt like I was wearing a nappy at all!Are they any good for sensitive skin? I have swapped from a sensitive single use brand which I still reacted to towards the end of my cycle, this has not been so with these.

Review Text: Why has it taken me until I'm 46 to discover these?! I only have a few years left before my periods come to a natural end - all those years of horrible environment destroying disposable pads and tampons - I'm both ashamed of myself for not using these sooner but also frustrated that these aren't being sold in mainstream stores and advertised on tv like they should be. They are super comfortable, super absorbent and leak proof and super great for the environment. I actually found them because I'm peri-menopausal and have been getting unmanageable heavy flooding that disposable pads have been useless for. In desperation for a solution I came across these. They are not as bulky to wear as they look and are so comfortable you don't notice they are there. Once you've got the hang of how to manage them (which is honestly not as hard as it looks) there is no going back. I shove them in the washing machine on a rinse cycle before putting them in the wash with the rest of my clothes (take that as a tip - you'd be amazed at how much blood they absorb), and then put them in the airing cupboard or on a radiator to dry (they take a while to completely dry out) - and then all good to go. It might be tricky drying these things discretely if you live in a house share :) but I'm sure you'll work it out if you do. If you have any specific questions, no matter how intimate, I'm happy to answer them. Just post a question and I'll look out for it. xx

Review Text: So I was a little reluctant about these but wanted to do something for the environment. The biggest question I had was what do I do with the wet ones after I've rinsed them and before I am planning to wash them - I assumed they would get smelly if left half full of water. Sooo I cheated a little - I don't know if this is fully advised, but I had 1 pack of the big ones and 1 pack of the small ones, and I just folded them up and put them in the wet bag after I was done with them, and I didn't actually rinse them till the end of my period. I didn't notice any smell from them in this time, in fact I only noticed the smell when I unfolded them to rinse at the end of the week. I also wasn't quite ready to get my hands dirty, so I had a stick with the round disk on the bottom that I just used to "beat" them in the water. The good news is I got all the blood out and left no stains and then washed them and they came out great, smelling clean and all. I don't know if they'll last quite as long my way of doing it, but it saves a little of the uncomfortableness of cleaning them. The one thing I would point out which is kind of a given, but not something I had really thought about prior - if you are transferring from regular pads, remember these ones aren't sticky - they only have the button in the middle, which means the ends can move around a bit. I actually use these with some period pants, because I have quite a heavy flow, and the combination definitely works for me - but make sure you are keeping an eye on where they are sitting.

Review Text: These are fantastic! I was deliberating about getting these for a while but i'm so glad that I did! I bought 2 boxes of the mix packs, which include 3 large and 3 medium sanitary towels, so 6 of each in total. I suffer with PCOS and generally very heavy periods. My periods usually last 7-8 days, so this was a perfect amount of pads for me. They have great absorbency, so I was going through 3-4 disposable sanitary towels a day, I now go through only 2 of these reusables on my heavy days and 1 on the lighter days. I also suffer with very sensitive skin so get very painful rashes from wearing disposable sanitary towels. I don't have any reactions with these which is amaing!! They wash really easily too! Just soak them in cold water in the sink when you take one off and put a new one on, this just gets rid of the worst of the blood and prevents staining. Wring the pad out and place it in the waterproof section of the wash bag they come with! At the end of your period just chuck them all in the washing machine, you can put the bags in too. I washed mine at 40degrees and they came out perfectly clean. Just don't use any fabric softener as this will decrease the absorbency! The only negative thing I have to say for them, is that because there is no sticky side to stick to your knickers, they can move about about a little bit, BUT, very simple solution, I just bought a roll of double sided body tape (or boob tape!) I put a few centimetres of tape at either end of the pad and it doesn't budge at all!! So overall, great product, saves so much money, much better for sensitive skin and better for the enviroment!!
Product Name: Eco Lily Reusable Sanitary Pads (6Pk for Heavy Flow)
review_text_raw: These are fantastic! I was deliberating about getting these for a while but i'm so glad that I did! I bought 2 boxes of the mix packs, which include 3 large and 3 medium sanitary towels, so 6 of each in total. I suffer with PCOS and generally very heavy periods. My periods usually last 7-8 days, so this was a perfect amount of pads for me. They have great absorbency, so I was going through 3-4 disposable sanitary towels a day, I now go through only 2 of these reusables on my heavy days and 1 on the lighter days. I also suffer with very sensitive skin so get very painful rashes from wearing disposable sanitary towels. I don't have any reactions with these which is amaing!! They wash really easily too! Just soak them in cold water in the sink when you take one off and put a new one on, this just gets rid of the worst of the blood and prevents staining. Wring the pad out and place it in the waterproof section of the wash bag they come with! At the end of your period just chuck them all in the washing machine, you can put the bags in too. I washed mine at 40degrees and they came out perfectly clean. Just don't use any fabric softener as this will decrease the absorbency! The only negative thing I have to say for them, is that because there is no sticky side to stick to your knickers, they can move about about a little bit, BUT, very simple solution, I just bought a roll of double sided body tape (or boob tape!) I put a few centimetres of tape at either end of the pad and it doesn't budge at all!! So overall, great product, saves so much money, much better for sensitive skin and better for the enviroment!!

Review Text: I've been using these for a few months now, and they're great! A while ago I switched from disposable pads to fancy (...and expensive) period pants, which still remain my ultimate solution for dealing with my period because of how comfortable they are... but at £20ish a pair I don't want to buy too many of them and I want them to last as long as possible.That's where these sanitary towels come in. They are a bit bulkier than the period pants and slightly prone to move around so I avoid wearing them when I'm being very active, but for overnight or times when I'm just lounging around the house then they are ideal. Comfort-wise I'd rate them slightly above disposable towels - I find the fleecy material is a lot nicer to touch, it doesn't have any adhesive to get stuck where it shouldn't, and there's no noisy plastic packaging to open.I've found washing them to be really easy - I just give them a cold rinse after use and store them up in the supplied wet bag until I'm ready put them through the washing machine on a low temperature. I was worried that the fleece material would end up permanently looking like something from a murder scene after the first use, but they ended up as-new after a go in the washer.EDIT: I went to buy some more of these four years later and found out I'd already left a review! So as an update, they are still going strong after four years of use and I think I could definitely keep using them, but I figured that the fleece material was perhaps not as soft as it was so I'd get some fresh ones.

Review Text: I've had those pads for 1.5 years and they're great for heavy flow. Not perfect but so far the best I've had compared to the most renown period pants and other pads. And great for milder flows.One of the advantages is that only the inner layers are sewn together in the shape of the pad. The outer layer is only sewn to the rest at the edge. This means blood cannot leak via the seams (if that makes sense).I've had leakage very quickly from pads where all of the layers are sewn together for the shape of the pad and it's extremely frustrating as you need to be changing them more often.These ones need changing as often as you would from thick disposable pads if you have really heavy flow, not so often for milder flows.They're soft and absorbant. Having the fleece all around makes these pads better than the more plastic materials. And they wash really well as long as you soak them before and they don't smell.I'd recommend those pads and will buy them again if mine ever need replacing.

Review Text: After reading the glowing reviews I invested in a pack of 6 large pads to test at night time. I'm in my 30s and have become sick of the waste and damage to my underwear that disposable ones cause. After my initial trial I was so pleased with the results that I bought 2 more packs, this time mixed packs to use during the day.These are so soft, I'd never noticed before how rough regular sanity pads are. The absorbency is great, I'm amazed how much these things can hold. The only icky thing I needed to get over was rinsing them out after use, but it's a small price to pay for comfy and re useable pads.Other reviewers have noted that these can move a little while wearing them, I have also found this but it's never been a problem for me, they are very easy to slip back into place. I used to find that regular sanity towels would move and flip over so these slipping a bit is not a downside of the product for me.I've changed over to using these day and night, I'm a total convert. Yes there are a little pricy but if they last the 5 years they say they will with proper care then they are a bargain in the long run.Another note I'd like to make is the superb customer service, after purchase I received a message of how to properly care for these which I found incredibly helpful.

Review Text: way more comfortable than anything else. these are really thick so it feels like wearing two extra pairs of underwear in one place. the only downside is if you have thin underwear they collapse quite easily meaning they'll just hang off while you're in the bathroom etc which gets quite annoying to reposition, wouldve gone for larger size if i knew itd be as tedious to adjust them all the time as the extra clasp would be helpful even on medium size. i don't wear these outside but they are great for lounging and hold a lot before you need to change. feel so much better than regular disposable and are SO waterproof even rinsing them aggressively the underside stays dry and only ever gets just about damp. would recommend to someone looking to make the change, i was hesitant at first but they have been a nice investment and i look forward to my period sometimes so i can enjoy the extra comfort from my regular underwear lol

Review Text: I ordered these during my menstural cycle so needed to use them straight away. Before using them I washed them by hand with cold water and dried them off as directed.I have been using reusable sanitary towels now for a couple of years. And these are by far the best ones I have used. They are extremely comfortable. For me they stay in place so had no issues with that atall. When I first opened them I did think 'wow they are large' but once they are clicked into place in your underwear and worn they are the perfect size. They don't feel too bulky (for me anyway)The design of them are lovely. Love the pattern and colours. The case for them is ideal if you are out and about. And great to store them away ready for next month!Overall I would generally recommend them.

Review Text: Fantastic product, I even wash them at high heats, I use detergent and softener wen washing them and then I put them in the dryer to dry them and they still work perfect, wouldn't buy any other brand, I'm currently in process of purchasing 6more as they are just fantastic, and I feel 12 is better than six so it saves me doing two loads of pad washing a day , if i have 12 this means I can pop my last one on at bed time and put the others to wash and dry ready for the following day.

Review Text: I really struggle to find any products that are comfortable and don't irritate my skon. These are incredible! Because you wash themIn your normal laundry detergent, it doesnt irritate the skin, they are easy to wash, dry fast and super soft.They are very absorbant! And unbelievably comfortable.Wor. Overnight with NO leaks or shifting so no marks left on my underwear like with disposable pads. Can be easily moved into the right place in your underwear and dtays there so no removing and adjusting over and over. Because of the silky material it makes NO noise while wearing.I actually forgot I was wearing a pad because its so comfortable.Have a heavy day and wore one pad for 6hrs with no issue (i realise heavy may mean different things to different people/ I'de normally have to replace my tampon every 90min).Would 1000% recommend to anyone who dislikes tampons, or doesnt like the feel of normal pads and also to anyone who gets skin irritation from the normal pads.These really are amazing.Do stick to the cleaning instructions really clearly!

Review Text: I've been using reuseable menstrual products or years now, but mainly the mooncup/ organicup prior to this. The problem was that sometimes I didn't want to go to the hassle of washing out the cup and putting it back in multiple times a day because it got to be a painful process with cramps. So I bought these and now use a mix of both. Wow, I wish i had earlier. They are so soft and comfy, with the poppers fastening pretty well. It's worth mentioning I wear really tight underwear and this stops them slipping. The heavy ones really do absorb loads and are great for the heaviest days.Like someone else said, I rinse mine in the shower and so actually handwash in the shower with bar soap then hang to dry. At the end of my period I'll then put them all in the washing machine for a final wash, and I think this method seems to prevent them wearing out so quickly? It's worth mentioning that I keep them flat while washing, and I never wring then out etc. The bags they come with are fab, the two pockets are great. Got to say, being someone who used a mooncup changing these pads in public toilets is MUCH easier than a mooncup! They fold up nicely into a small square when used (secured with poppers) and you can just stuff them in the wetbag.Got to say I also appreciate the black and grey with the purple design- I don't really want to be walking around with bright coloured pads with twee designs on them as a 32 year old woman!Been using them for about 5 months now and they are still fresh and absorbent. I have the pantyliners too and they can also hold a lot. Let's face it it also feels great knowing you aren't polluting the earth with more disposable crap taking absolute years (if it even does at all?) to breakdown...which for me is the best point 👍

Review Text: When I first tried these I thought "ok they are super bulky and this feels weird!!" But and a big BUT, you will never feel safer. Nothing is getting past these bad boys.I bought the pack with 3 large and 3 medium. Both sizes can hold heavy flow but ofc, choose the large for these days.How do they hold up compared to disposable:A normal Ultra pad (meant to last 5 hours) would last me max 3 hours (and accidents often occured) in comparison, a large of these reusable pads lasts me half a day and 0 accidents. Ever. Did I mention EVER?Does it smell?Find they smell less than disposables. But it's impossible for anything hold blood for hours and to be odour free.How do I wash them:Ok so it's more work than rolling up your disposable and chucking it in the bin. First time I washed these, they came out of the washing machine still looking dirty but I didn't throw them away. I did some research and ever since they come out of the washing machine looking like new.Step 1: soak in cold water for 30 minStep 2: rinse with cold water will litle blood is coming out of them (takes maybe 10 min when doing all 6?) Rinse and squeeze. Rinse and squeeze.Step 3: there are stains, get a bit of hand soap, squirt it on the pad and rub the pad against itself (or use your hand if you aren't grossed out).Step 4: rinse away the soap, stain should be gone. If not repeat this step.Step 5: throw it in the washing machine with your clothes. DONT use fabric softenerStep 6: air dry on the line.Step 7: enjoy perfectly amazing pad again

Review Text: I purchased these 23/08/19 and they are still serving me well 05/01/24. It's absolutely amazing value for money.I have saved an absolute fortune by using these! My periods have always been super heavy. I used to use to go through a combination sanitary towels and tampons for the very heaviest bleeding very frequently in the first couple of days of my periods and still leak 😞.Although I still have to change these frequently during the 1st couple of days of my period, i do so less frequently and no longer needs tampons as well as sanitary towels. I have saved an absolute fortune in sanitary protection, not to mention the eco benefits for the environment.I'd say the design of this product is a spark of genius. Good for your pocket and the environment.The only slight criticism I'd have is that if your underwear is not snug and secure, the towel is likely to slip and slide. The seller does recommend using snug fitting lycra / cotton underwear with a wider gusset. I would definitely suggest doing this if you move about a lot.This product gets 10 starts out of 5 from me. It's paid for itself multiple times over.I have no reservations in wholeheartedly recommending it. I would suggest purchasing snug fitting lycra or cotton underwear with a wider gusset, as the seller suggests to go with it. You will save a lot more than you spend on these items in the the long run.

Review Text: This is the third different brand of cloth sanitary pads that I've bought and it's definitely my favourite. I've been using cloth pads for a couple of years now and wish I'd discovered these earlier. Here's my breakdown:Absorbency: So good I had to remind myself to change them more regularly. The first day I accidentally wore it all day! I also found them very comfortable, no wet feeling at all, even on a heavy day. I had NO LEAKS. Literally none the whole week except for the day I ran out of this style and had to revert to a different brand. BOTH of my other style leaked which just goes to show that the length and size of the Eco Lily's is great.Comfort: There's no denying that if you've never used washable fabric pads before you'll find these bulkier than the disposable kind (unless you bought the cheap homebrand type which feel like footballs). This will initially take some getting used to but it doesn't take long until you forget about it. I found the front of the Eco Lily pads stayed in place really well (hence no leaks) however sometimes it did get a bit bunched up at the back. I have the same problem with other brands I've had though so it might just be my big butt. That is literally my ONLY criticism of this product and cit ertainly wouldn't stop me buying more of them because that sometimes happens with disposable pads too.Cleanliness: I love the grey fabric which means you won't see discolouration of the fabric. My other styles, after a long time of using them, have discoloured now and are a bit unpleasant to look at. That shouldn't happen with the Eco Lily. I found them super easy to rinse after removal and then to handwash with soap later on. The water ran clear much more quickly with this style than my other style which I washed at the same time. I imagine that means it'll clean more effectively in the machine as well.Appearance: I like the purple pattern on the water resistant fabric. It would be nice if they had a range of styles though (like other brands do) because it is fun to have funky fabrics to choose from however let's be honest, it's going straight into our underwear so why does it matter? In summary, I highly recommend this product and will be buying more. Other versions I've seen online can be ridiculously expensive (I even had to pay import duty on some a couple of years ago!) so these are excellent value as well.

Review Text: Firstly let me say I am thrilled that there are so many eco friendly alternatives to standard plastic filled sanitary products and I am here to praise that. So I was really looking forward to using these pads because of reading a lot of previous positive reviews and I was intrigued to see what I would make of them myself. My period usually lasts about 7 days; heavy for the first 3 then significantly reduces and I was genuinely surprised with just how much these pads absorbed! I think I used between 3 and 4 on my heavy days and then down to 2 and just needed 1 on both day 6 and 7. This made me very happy as I was worried about leaking which thankfully did not happen. The pads were easy to rinse under the cold water tap first before washing them through properly on a 30° or 40° cycle. I thought they would be really long, from looking at others pictures but they actually didn't seem that long in reality perhaps just slightly longer than a night pad. The overall look was nice, good quality, packaged nicely, the material was comfortable and soft, the popper was good quality and didn't come undone at any point either. Unfortunately I do have some negative points about the product which could just be my own personal experience but I wanted to give a completely honest review.1. I thought the pad needed an extra popper fastener, there is the option to have a looser or tighter fitting but whilst on the tightest fitting there is no other popper to use, to fasten the extra bit of wing, so it just sort of flaps about and can be annoying.2. I felt the pad wasn't as secure as others had mentioned, it was perhaps the silkly material on the back of the pad which made it more prone to slipping if I wasn't wearing tight trousers.3. I am sad to say that whilst the pads were a soft comfortable material against my skin, they were not comfortable overall whilst active. I went out for a walk wearing one of these and it was the most awful thing. It felt like I had a nappy on, I kept having to rearrange, I was very aware of it being there and it made it far less enjoyable. I will admit when I went for a walk again I swapped the pad for an tampon to avoid the nappy like sensation.I understand not everyone's views will be the same, this was my own personal experience and I do plan on continuing to use these as often as I can. It just means that I will perhaps look into a cup or plastic free tampons for when I'm out and about.

I thought the pad needed an extra popper fastener, there is the option to have a looser or tighter fitting but whilst on the tightest fitting there is no other popper to use, to fasten the extra bit of wing, so it just sort of flaps about and can be annoying.2. I felt the pad wasn't as secure as others had mentioned, it was perhaps the silkly material on the back of the pad which made it more prone to slipping if I wasn't wearing tight trousers.3. I am sad to say that whilst the pads were a soft comfortable material against my skin, they were not comfortable overall whilst active. I went out for a walk wearing one of these and it was the most awful thing. It felt like I had a nappy on, I kept having to rearrange, I was very aware of it being there and it made it far less enjoyable. I will admit when I went for a walk again I swapped the pad for an tampon to avoid the nappy like sensation.I understand not everyone's views will be the same, this was my own personal experience and I do plan on continuing to use these as often as I can. It just means that I will perhaps look into a cup or plastic free tampons for when I'm out and about.
review_text: Firstly let me say I am thrilled that there are so many eco friendly alternatives to standard plastic filled sanitary products and I am here to praise that. So I was really looking forward to using these pads because of reading a lot of previous positive reviews and I was intrigued to see what I would make of them myself. My period usually lasts about 7 days; heavy for the first 3 then significantly reduces and I was genuinely surprised with just how much these pads absorbed! I think I used between 3 and 4 on my heavy days and then down to 2 and just needed 1 on both day 6 and 7. This made me very happy as I was worried about leaking which thankfully did not happen. The pads were easy to rinse under the cold water tap first before washing them through properly on a 30° or 40° cycle. I thought they would be really long, from looking at others pictures but they actually didn't seem that long in reality perhaps just slightly longer than a night pad. The overall look was nice, good quality, packaged nicely, the material was comfortable and soft, the popper was good quality and didn't come undone at any point either. Unfortunately I do have some negative points about the product which could just be my own personal experience but I wanted to give a completely honest review.1. I thought the pad needed an extra popper fastener, there is the option to have a looser or tighter fitting but whilst on the tightest fitting there is no other popper to use, to fasten the extra bit of wing, so it just sort of flaps about and can be annoying.2. I felt the pad wasn't as secure as others had mentioned, it was perhaps the silkly material on the back of the pad which made it more prone to slipping if I wasn't wearing tight trousers.3. It felt like I had a nappy on, I kept having to rearrange, I was very aware of it being there and it made it far less enjoyable. I will admit when I went for a walk again I swapped the pad for an tampon to avoid the nappy like sensation.I understand not everyone's views will be the same, this was my own personal experience and I do plan on continuing to use these as often as I can. It just means that I will perhaps look into a cup or plastic free tampons for when I'm out and about.

Review Text: I've been wanting to go plastic-free for a long time, but I've always been nervous because I've had heavy periods all my life. I love the idea of mooncups but I don't like tampons, so I've always known I'd need a non-invasive plastic-free alternative to the sanitary towels I've been using for years. Now that I have these, I'd never go back!Firstly, these towels are so, so comfortable. We get used to having to wear plastic in our pants, but now I have these I wonder how I ever put up with plastic for so long. My periods are so much more comfortable now, I don't have plastic sticking to my thighs or anywhere else, and these towels barely move at all either.There can be some movement, but it all depends on the kind of underwear you wear. I tend to wear my tighter-fitting underwear during my period now that I have these towels and they never move, and they've also never moved while I've been asleep either which is pretty amazing - I fall asleep on my front but I always wake up on my back, so there's plenty of opportunity for them to move around! I haven't had any leaks either, which amazes me considering I often leaked when I was using plastic sanitary towels and often ended up having to wear two at a time.These towels are easy enough to clean, too - I shove them in the washing machine at 30 degrees for around 20-30 minutes and then dry them overnight on my radiator and they're ready to be used again. I have noticed there can be some staining, but the towel is clean, so I think I might try soaking them in cold water before I wash them which the box recommends to avoid staining.I also think these would be wonderful for anyone who's just started their period - particularly younger people who start their period while they're in school. A zip-up bag comes in the box for your used towels until you can get home to wash them, and I think they'd be so much more discreet for any school-age person who's perhaps nervous about starting their period. I wish I'd known these were an option when I was 12 years old!They're comfortable, absorbent and so much better for the environment - what's not to love?
Product Name: Eco Lily Reusable Sanitary Pads (6Pk for Heavy Flow)

Review Text: My daughter is at the age her first period could start anytime. She carries a pack of sanitary towels in her school bag "just in case"Thinking back to my own experience of my first period, it was actually quite traumatising. I flow heavily each time and can be in agonising pain with cramps as well as lower back pain. Other than a talk at school informing girls there was only 2 products on the market, pads or tampons. Little other information was given. So the amount of blood and the pain I was in, I literally thought something was seriously wrong and I was dying!Not wanting this for my daughter, I'm completely open with her and she is comfortable in asking me all kinds of questions.One of the biggest bugbear of mine, is how wet I feel with every pad and constantly needing to change. Self conscious about leakage was a particular worry when I was at school, scared all the boys could see and smell the blood.I hate pads with a passion and I've never felt tampons are appropriate for a young girl first starting out so I looked into seeing if there is anything new on the market.Of course you can buy period underwear, but most say to be worn in conjunction with pads/tampons. Which kind of defeats the purpose.My sister-in-law told me she uses a moon cup. But like tampons, not sure it's ideal for my daughter. But then I came across the reusable eco lily pads. I read reviews which were great but everyone is different right? Best way to really test them is using them myself.Omg! I wish these was available when I was a girl. I have felt so dry through out, they're so comfortable to wear and never moved. Best of all, far few changes needed. I could easily get through 3-4 packs of towels for a 5 day period. However, I have only used 2 towels a day! One in the morning that lasts through the day and a change before bed.So easy to clean, does not smell and no irritation as the material is so soft against your skin, unlike disposable pads that can cause nappy rash!I will be donating my daughters school bag pack to a Womens homeless shelter and I will be buying her eco lily instead for when she starts. I've already talked her through what to do with them and shes ready but also excited as in her words "they look cool"I honestly believe eco lily will help my daughters first period a much more pleasant experience than my traumatic experience in the 90's.
Product Name: Eco Lily Reusable Sanitary Pads (6Pk for Heavy Flow)

Review Text: I have been considering switching to reusable sanitary products for many months now, so I bought these on a whim when my preferred brand of disposables was unavailable. I have previously tried a few different cups with no avail, so cloth pads seemed like the way to go!I bought a box each of the regular and large/heavy flow size, which is more than enough to get me through my period. I'd say that the medium size is equivalent to most disposables, whereas the heavy flow pads are more the size of maternity towels. Otherwise there is not a huge amount of difference, besides an extra popper on the large ones.These pads are extremely comfortable to wear, and easy to attach to using the poppers. They're very soft, and they don't bunch up or move around too much. I've experienced no leakage whatsoever, even on my heaviest days, and I've found that these pads feel much drier in between changes. They can hold a lot! For this reason I'm having to change less often, which eases the burden on washing them.Cleaning them is easy - just rinse with cold water, then wash on a 30° cycle without any conditioner. I usually leave mine in a tub of cold water until I have enough to wash together. They come out looking good as new, which I'm sure the dark grey colour helps with!I especially like that each pack includes a waterproof travel bag, with a separate space for your wet and dry pads, so it's easy to change on the go.Overall, I'm really pleased with these and I definitely won't be going back to disposables. These are more comfortable, more absorbent, more cost effective in the long run, and much less damaging to the environment. The only way they could be improved is if all sizes included the 2 poppers, as I can get a much better fit that way.
Product Name: Eco Lily Reusable Sanitary Pads (6Pk for Heavy Flow)

Review Text: I wanted to love these, but they just didn't hit the mark for me. Here's why:Cons:-Very thick, to the point you can see them through even a thick pair of jeans, so you're limited in what you can wear.-Very warm fabric, makes your hooha sweaty and doesn't let the area breathe, this results in you feeling really uncomfortable and hot down there.-The biggest con is the fact they aren't wide enough. There are 2 sets of adjustable buttons, and I was so shocked to see the 'loosest' button was still quite tight. You need to be wearing panties that have a very thin gusset so that the buttons can clip comfortably underneath without creating a bulge. I know most women tend to wear comfier loser panties when on their period due to pain and bloating, but it seems these pads were made to be put on top of a thong or something similar. I'd say this was the biggest con for me.-They slide back and forth and need to be 'adjusted' at times.-Really unpleasant charcoal type smell even after washing several times as the instructions state, the smell would make me sick, this is before even using them.-Blood clots remain sitting on top and aren't absorbed the way they are with traditional pads.-Washing these pads is very tedious and sort of gross. You can't place them directly in the washing machine without hand washing first, but doing that was a bit gnarly for me - period blood is not something a person enjoys touching or seeing running down my sink. Plus it was time consuming to wash, especially if you're a busy mother like me who also works full time and has a thousand other things going on, washing these pads before putting in the machine was an added chore.PROS-Great long length-Can hold an impressive amount of fluid.After using these for 3 cycles and really trying to enjoy the benefits of saving money on pads and not being exposed to harmful chemicals with traditional pads, I decided they weren't for me, so I actually threw them away a few days ago. It's a shame because I genuinely really wanted to like these.Hope this review helps!
