It's a shame because I genuinely really wanted to like these.Hope this review helps!
review_text: I wanted to love these, but they just didn't hit the mark for me. Here's why:Cons:-Very thick, to the point you can see them through even a thick pair of jeans, so you're limited in what you can wear.-Very warm fabric, makes your hooha sweaty and doesn't let the area breathe, this results in you feeling really uncomfortable and hot down there.-The biggest con is the fact they aren't wide enough. There are 2 sets of adjustable buttons, and I was so shocked to see the 'loosest' button was still quite tight. You need to be wearing panties that have a very thin gusset so that the buttons can clip comfortably underneath without creating a bulge. I know most women tend to wear comfier loser panties when on their period due to pain and bloating, but it seems these pads were made to be put on top of a thong or something similar. I'd say this was the biggest con for me.-They slide back and forth and need to be 'adjusted' at times.-Really unpleasant charcoal type smell even after washing several times as the instructions state, the smell would make me sick, this is before even using them.-Blood clots remain sitting on top and aren't absorbed the way they are with traditional pads.-Washing these pads is very tedious and sort of gross. You can't place them directly in the washing machine without hand washing first, but doing that was a bit gnarly for me - period blood is not something a person enjoys touching or seeing running down my sink. Plus it was time consuming to wash, especially if you're a busy mother like me who also works full time and has a thousand other things going on, washing these pads before putting in the machine was an added chore.PROS-Great long length-Can hold an impressive amount of fluid.After using these for 3 cycles and really trying to enjoy the benefits of saving money on pads and not being exposed to harmful chemicals with traditional pads, I decided they weren't for me, so I actually threw them away a few days ago. It's a shame because I genuinely really wanted to like these.Hope this review helps!

Review Text: So I've actually been using these for two years now and finally got round to writing a review.In my two years of using these I can honestly say they look as good as new! Yes, they're a different way of thinking about periods and hygiene but there are so many benefits of using these.1) I have found these really absorbent and as someone who suffers with heavy periods, I have no longer had any flooding incidents.2) although a little bulky to wear, they're quite comfortable and not smelly at all.3) I like the fact I'm helping the environment! No more disposable used pads in landfill.4) they're surprisingly easy to clean. What I have found over the years is keeping a little bin (with a lid) that sits next to my loo, filled with cold water to store the used ones in. I give them a rinse before they go in the bin to get the excess blood out. But I actually don't bother if I'm out and about! If I'm about to shower, it sits in the bottom of the shower to rinse before going in my cold water bin!4) you get a handy water proof pouch to pop them in. When I get home, they go in my water filled bin.5) when I'm ready, they go in my washing machine and come out as good as new. They go in my tumble dryer too! Every month after they've been in the machine, I do run a cleaning cycle as I then know I'm keeping my machine clean!6) I've saved money!! Yes they're an initial outlay, but before long you've got your money back.No downsides really, and I'm glad I've switched to these. I would 100% recommend!
Product Name: Eco Lily Reusable Sanitary Pads (6Pk for Heavy Flow)

Review Text: They're quite absorbant but I've only used one so far, as I'm a little nervous using it at night but will try and I will update the review in due course.They're quite comfy and not that thick when you compare to maternity pads which in my opionion are quite thick.Update February 2023So I've had a few cycles since buying (October 2022) and they are really great. I used to go through 2packs of the disposable liners (I would wear the night liners as I felt more protection from them. I would change my pad every four hours during the heaviest days my period.The reusable pads are great because the only thing I have to worry about is making sure I have a clean set for my next cycle but that's easy as I have a regular laundry routine and just throw them in with my clothes after I have hand-washed them.They may take some getting used to especially if you're coming from the thin disposable pads because they're quite thick, especially the heavy pads compared to the regular flow pads.During my heaviest flow days I now wear the regular flow pads when I'm out and about, I'm normally out for about 5 hours and I walk to all my destinations so it lasts all that time, however I used to wear the heavy flow ones initially when I went out and about because I thought that the extra protection was needed but it is not the case. If I was going to be doing a lot of sitting down I would wear the heavy pads as I tend bleed to the back and its just better protection for me.I've only had one bleedthrough and that was my own fault because I didn't change my pad before going to bed as I was exhausted but even then it was a small amount of spotting on my clothes instead of well the mess that usually occurs when you bleed through.Another big bonus is that I no longer get a rash, I used to always get a rash whenever I used disposable pads, it would be by the crease of my thigh and vulva, not sure why I would get a rash but ever since going reusable I've not had a rash, which is a big relief.I have purchased another pack to make it a total of 6 heavy flow pads and 6 regular flow pads as although I was managing with just 3 regular and 3 heavy flow I'd have to wash them as soon as I changed one otherwise I'd have one less for the next day if that makes sense, at least this way I can rinse them and put them in the wash bag until laundry day as I do laundry for the household twice a week. If you're curious about cloth pads I definitely recommend you buy the 3+3 heavy/regular combination so you have a nice mix.I wash mine on a 40degree wash because I do not have the patience to be messing around with buttons to adjust the temperature on a wash to 30degrees.I will eventually be buying 100% pure cotton pads from somebody that actually makes cloths pads but they're quite expensive and your period isn't going to wait until you have the funds to buy the nice cloth pads.As much as I wanted to stop using plastic (microfiber is a plastic) the fact that I've gone from single use plastic to reusable is a start and I think if you're curious about whether cloth pads are for you then this is a great way to find out as they're with you within a couple of days because amazon instead of whatever the 2-3week wait whilst your order is created and then another wait for it to be delivered. If you're coming from disposable sanitary items definitely give them a try.

Review Text: I bought these for early days postpartum recovery. They are great large size, really soft and look fit for purpose. I plan to use these for the first few days and then switch to a large overnight Rael pad (Rael are more natural but don't come in a large enough size in the UK). Would potentially look elsewhere if I had stitches down below though due to use of chemicals. I'm having a C-section so less worried about them being gentle for a couple of days use. The cost of these are really cheap for what they are.

Review Text: I've tried a few different brands in the days following giving birth for the 2nd time, and these are by far the best. They are really wide and contoured to fit, and extra padded which has offered great support as I required a lot of stitches. They also have worked really well with my disposable maternity underwear so I've been really comfortable during my recovery. Almost 2 weeks down the line and I've gone back to using these (I had switched to a lighter duty product) as they offer the best comfort in my opinion.

Review Text: I've never had children but am approaching the pesky perimenopausal years where no sanitary pad is man enough to do the job unless you're prepared to use tampons alongside the pad, which is what I do. Even the Infinity Always pad doesn't stand up to my flow and I get leaks. I bought these as having skipped a couple of periods and my period has just started so I am expecting a deluge. Opened them today and laughed at how big they are, put one in my knickers and, yes, it does feel like you're wearing a nappy but they are comfortable and soft and I immediately felt secure. I will write an update when I know if these will stand up to Aunt Flo. UPDATE: So having come to the end of Auntie Flo I found that these didn't stay stuck to the inside of my underwear for more than a day before they came unstuck and started bunching up at the back. They leaked at the side a little but like I said I was expecting a heavier period so I was half expecting some...mess. I think I will probably use these for the first couple of days in the future and then switch down to an Always or Bodyform pad afterwards.

Review Text: If your looking for a product post pregnancy that has a lot of soak, then these are for you! Probably work for incontinence as well but from a pregnancy perspective, these are big enough, thick enough and durable enough to handle post bleeding. I like to feel secure and these did the job for me.Obviously at some point it will need changing. Don't think you can leave it on all day and you're not going to leak through because you will, I'm just saying you can bide your time in these more instead of running to change every few minutes.

Review Text: I have been using this for over 2 years now. The quality remains excellent. However, I noticed that in the last 2-3 months they have reduced the length of these pads significantly. The pervious ones gave full coverage front to back which was exceptionally good for those with heavy flow. I preferred this brand for its overall quality and size. But the size reduction has upset me. I believe this pad is available as a standard size, therefore I am wondering if anyone has felt the same size reduction or have I received the wrong size (if they offer variations-not that I have seen anywhere)PS. Would have given a 5 star for its overall quality but 3 is bcoz of reduction in size.

Review Text: I got these pads for postpartum care. I ended up having a c section so my bleeding was not on the crazy side however I am still positive they will aid any level of bleeding and still provide comfort. Although these pads are large they fit in standard knickers and I haven't experienced them rubbing against my incision on my belly. I've also had no leaks from any direction so for me it's money well spent. Additionally, I also have stuck some of these to the inside of my pj top to help absorb the crazy amount of milk that splutter out of my boobs, no nipple chafe and absorbed the milk great!

Review Text: I don't know, ladies, why people are complaining about these. 3 days out of hospital, still needing proper cover for the region in discussion, these are the ones I started using as soon as I could get off the bed and reach my hospital bag (well, suitcase), despite the hospital providing some other ones which were narrower and leaked all over the bed, clothes, body.To use simple language and speak the reality, maternity pads, you want them BIG. These are big. You want them SOFT (although, let's admit it, nothing will really be for a week or two), these are soft, as soft as any of them get. You want them DISPOSABLE. These are; 2nd, 3rd, and, especially, 1st time around you don't want to spend those 5 precious minutes and last of your iron and energy washing something so messy. Yes, they don't have wings and manage to leak a tiny bit, but remember the days when we had to use pads every month, those were never perfect, were they?And, as with all 'intrusive' objects, there will be a bit of soreness to the nearby area, but all pads cause that, and it's not the pad but the experience, so just remember, it all goes, and it takes time, and YOU WILL BE GOOD AS NEW, although it definitely does not seem so at this time. Just breathe, relax, feed the baby, change their nappies, have warm relaxing showers, a bit of favourite sweets, some lovely tea, give other participating parties a hug and remember how you felt on your very best day: that will soon happen again. You will get there.2 weeks later, these are still steady favourites after a week with winged Cottons and the ones from the local store. Cannot fault them in any way, should have bought 10 packs in the first place.And now, nearly 3 months later, and looking back, these were still the best ones. They do have rivals, Boots have very similar pads but theirs are slightly bigger, with a smaller, interrupted 'stick-on' area; however Boots sell theirs 50p cheaper, which might make a difference if you need them for 2 months like myself.Yes, and you are not using them to soak them up. Dispose of these regularly, better buy more and change them more often than end up on antibiotics.

Review Text: I bought these for my postpartum and to be honest, I think they were overall great.The pads are very big, like, really; which is also what you need during that first week of postpartum... their thickness helps cushion the area when you sit, which is perfect if you have stitches. The texture is very soft, much softer than any other pad, however because of this, you also don't get the same level of absorption in the pad. Since you have to change pads very often, this is not a problem. Also, the fact that the lochia won't be completely filtered in the pads helps you observe the colour of it; which is important information to report to your midwife.After using a whole pack, I moved to another brand given that I didn't need such big pads anymore. I do recommend these pads at least for the first postpartum week. Also, price/value is great.
Product Name: ABENA Premium Maternity Pads, Postpartum Essentials, Eco-Labelled, Extra Protection, After Birth, Breathable and Skin Friendly, Sustainable Incontinence Pads - 15PK

Review Text: I've had the most horrid time trying to find a pad in the U.K that could help with my heavy periods. Imagine my relief and joy when I found these pads. Not only do they help with containing the flow but with the strong absorption ability it gives a dry feel. This is something we women need, it helps get rid of that icky damp cold touch that some of the best pads in the market cannot achieve. Hence I gave it 5 stars. One tiny drawback is the thin adherence sticky strip that's just okay and could be made better. However it has no negative impact on the functioning of the pad.

Review Text: There's nothing worse than being confident using one brand of sanitary towel only for the manufacturer to change it so it no longer suits you.I was advised to try these and I am so glad that I did!When you initially get them you think they might be too long and perhaps uncomfortable but no, they feel so comfortable even though they are more padded than most.They are very well made with just the right shaping so that they don't concertina in at the sides or roll up at either end,been when worn at night (the problem I have had with others).They are very soft to wear and they are not scented so are kind to sensitive skin.Very well made, incredibly comfortable despite their size and I felt very confident wearing them - so much so that I have come back to buy some more!I highly recommend them.

Review Text: I bought these because of heavy periods due to endometriosis. Even the super absorbent period pads don't work but these do. I pair with postpartum underwear and it is very good! These are unscented and breathable meaning they don't irritate the skin. I love how even with periods they don't have any odour like some other incontinence wear does when used in a period setting. They are also cheaper and a lot better. These are a staple for me now! I wish they done some with wings as I do wriggle when I sleep and they sometimes displace around that area at the crotch. But they are a lot wider and longer than period pads and definitely thicker! Very happy

Review Text: These were great for use immediately after childbirth. The size of the pads is super large but this is what makes it perfect for the heavy blood flow immediately post birth. I've knocked off one star as they don't have wings which meant that I had some very minor leakages at the side of the pads which ended up causing some blood to get onto my pants. This was ok given that I was wearing disposables but if they had wings they literally would be perfect. Other than that that the absorption, size and comfort were all fabulous and I would definitely recommend post birth. I used these then switched to lil let's maternity pads with wings as bleeding was getting lighter. One pack was more than enough for me before switching.

Review Text: 5 months ago, we welcomed our beautiful baby girl. I had a natural birth and required a few stitches. I gained a healthy amount of weight... UK16.These pads were fantastic! They provided enough coverage that I didn't have any leaks, pull and sticky-free, and a soft, cushioned interior to provide comfort. I wore them whilst at home for the first two weeks and now and again during the day thereafter, alternating with another smaller pad.Buy yourself some huge, full coverage knickers (I bought from Matalan) and you don't need to fuss with those built in maternity "nappies".How many to buy depends on your flow but if you were to buy 4 packs, I can guarantee, any left-overs can be used for when you start your menstrual cycle.
Product Name: ABENA Premium Maternity Pads

Review Text: Very impressed with these sanitary towels. These are by far the softest and most pleasant feeling pads I've ever used - and this is having tried many different brands. The cotton really does make a difference with how it feels against the skin, even though I was skeptical at first. More environmentally friendly, breathable and without any fragrance, they also have a good level of absorption whilst not being too thick. I would say the glue is stickier than other mainstream brands I've used (eg Always), but they still peel off cleanly (instead of leaving strips of plastic like some do!) You can't fault them for their performance and I would 100% repurchase.

Review Text: I've been switching gradually to more eco-conscious period care, and these Naty sanitary towels have genuinely impressed me. Despite being fully compostable and made without any plastic, they perform just as reliably as the mainstream brands. The cotton topsheet feels soft and breathable against the skin --- no irritation, no itchiness, and no artificial fragrance trying to disguise anything.They're slim yet absorbent, stay securely in place throughout the day, and the leak protection is surprisingly good even on heavier flow days. The individual paper wrappers are discreet and recyclable, which is a thoughtful touch.It's great to see a brand taking sustainability seriously without compromising comfort or performance. If you're looking to make a simple swap that's kinder to both your body and the environment, these are well worth trying.

Review Text: These pads (Super with Wings) are a breath of fresh air compared to traditional pads, which tend to contain irritating synthetic fragrances and plastic.In contrast, these are really comfortable, and soft to wear. They also don't make crinkling noises like plastic ones. They also don't feel bulky to wear, and feel discreet. The general adhesive sticks to my underwear superbly, and the wings totally keep the pad from moving.I really like that there's no added fragrances to these pads, as they just aren't needed. I have sensitive skin, and I feel far less irritated and itchy using these than the mainstream brands.They're much kinder to my allergies, and I've even noticed I sweat less when wearing them.Personally, I haven't experienced any cotton shedding, though my day-to-day activities aren't overly active.Overall, the absorbency is decent. For very heavy flows, I'd probably want a bit more protection, but they're great for the average to heavy period. My favourite time to wear these is at night for extra peace of mind. To conclude, I'd definitely order this brand of pads again.

Review Text: We use Naty nappies for our baby so I was curious to try these pads for myself. Naty brand produces good quality products with fairly good eco credentials, these pads are no exception. They use Oeko-tex certified 'fabrics'and responsibly sourced forest pulp. Many materials are compostable and no plastic touches the skin. I like that the manufacturer clearly describes what materials have been used to make these pads (unlike many other manufacturers). I think that it is important to treat the skin in this part of the body with care and respect as it is thinner and more sensitive.I mostly use period pants but I got these pads to use in an emergency and/or in addition to my period pants. I can't comment on the absorbency/leaks as I haven't been able to try the pads just yet (postpartum). However they do appear to be soft and nice to use.
Product Name: Naty Sanitary Pads Super – Plantbased and absorbent for Women, Organic Cotton Menstrual Product, Better for Feminine Health (12 Count)

Review Text: Decent quality pads that offer good absorption for moderate to heavy loss.These are very, very similar to the Amazon Basics Maxi pads, the only difference being that these are slightly shaped to be wider at the back.Both brands feature a floral decoration which isn't really necessary.The plastic pouch that wraps each pad could be used for wrapping a lightly-used pad; useful in locations without a sanitary bin.These pads can't really cope with very heavy overnight loss, but are very suitable as liners for shaped, non-adhesive pads.

Review Text: I've tried a couple of different brands of resusable pads before, and personally I find ecolily the best. The pads are very absorbent - I could go through the night without needing to change, with no overflow, and the pads don't feel heavy even when full. The fleece extends across the whole pads including the wings, which is great because unlike others, it means it doesn't stain across the sides. The fleece is comparatively thicker than on some other brands so these pads can seem a bit bulky at first, but I personally find that more secure because I know I don't need to worry about leaking. They're very comfortable and easy to clean, just rinse them in cold water then pop them in the wash without fabric softener, and tumble dry.The only downside I would say is that the carry bag it comes with isn't large enough to hold all 6 pads at the same time, so it wouldn't be practical if you couldn't use washing facilities every day. But if you're just at home/school/work, then they're definitely a brand worth checking out.

Review Text: Made the transition to reusable pads and if you're also considering it I can highly recommend this brand - I ordered medium and large and they are sized really well. The large is similar to the Bodyform Nightime pads but far softer, more comfortable and doesn't have the itchiness of a disposable pad. You don't have to worry about these leaking through, they are thick without being bulky and they seem to be made with care.The buttons are a lot more secure than the shoddy adhesive on disposables. The only downside to all reusable pads is that you need to wash them, however this isn't a big issue given that you're saving money and it's also way more comfortable to wear these compares to disposables. Yes it's a much bigger cost upfront but it's absolutely worth it, these also don't contain the same nasty ingredients that disposable pads and tampons do.

Review Text: They are comfy on the skin. The 1st time I used them, they were moving too much on the panties and I got spotting.. here some tips:I would reccomend to use them with tight panties, the ones i was using that day were not so the pad was moving.The absorb a lot for sure, even the smaller ones. Easy to clean, just wash in the sink with cold water till the water gets clean and after in the washing machine.No smell at all, and when they're dirty you can fold them and keep them in you bag inside their little black bag that arrives together with the pads. I couldn't fit them all in that bag tho, but when you are not home for work or for the day, you don't need to bring them all. In general, I feel satisfied of it and of my decision to not to use the normal pads anymore. I bought them cause I didn't want the normal pads to irritate my skin, these one are soft and they feel good

Review Text: I've been trying to change to eco sanitary products for over a year. I tried the cup but didn't get on with it (or a few options actually). Then when the covid19 pandemic caused all the shops to run out of my usual sanitary pads I found these... I was sceptical at first, but wow these are a game changer. I'm so pleased I invested in these. They are so much more comfortable than regular pads (that used to give me a rash). I don't like tampons as I can't get on with them so pads are all I use. They're super absorbant. They feel great against my skin. They are a little thicker than a regular pad, but you get used to it. It's like having a soft plush pillow between your legs! Washing is easy, just bung them in the machine (unfolded) and run on a normal wash (no more than 40 degrees) but don't add fabric softener. Then they go in the tumble dryer on a synthetic (lower heat) cycle and they're done. They are brilliant. No waste and no rashes. I highly recommend these. They might get a bit warm in summer with them being thicker but it's a small price to pay to save my skin! If you were umming an ahhing about buying these, don't. Just get them. They are an investment worth getting. Big thumbs up!

Review Text: I suffer from the most horrendous heavy periods. Using 6 nighttime pads a night usually and leaking onto the bed. Then I was told by some friends to use an adult nappy as I was so heavy. I cannot usually leave the house first and second day as it's so bad. I usually go through 15 pads on those days. Today I used my first Eco Pad! Only 1, no leak, even looked like there was no bleeding. It's so comfortable and I felt assured it wasn't going to leak. Washed it straight away and I was amazed how much it contained. I'm totally converted and now telling all my girlfriends who suffer with heavy periods. One of the best investments I've ever made!

Review Text: These pads are lovely and soft, they don't give you that nasty rash that towels do. The heavy ones would work fine a woman with a normal period, but they do not provide enough protection if you have developed fibroids and are losing up to 200mls plus per flood. They are lovely and comfy though. Worth it for normal flow. I will use these again for day 3-6 but not for first 3 days.

Review Text: These are great, Ive used them for 2 months now and don't think I'd go back to normal pads. I could go like 8 hours without changing the pad on a heavy period and it doesn't leak through, it absorbs really well, it's hard to tell sometimes if its full as it doesn't have that wet, sitting in a puddle feeling like normal pads but if left on too long can get that period smell. They're pretty easy to clean. I usually just rinse it while i have a shower until the water runs clear and then squeeze a bit of soap on it and rinse it then stick it in with the washing and usually use an antibacterial liquid that will make sure everything is sanitised and wont hold on to smells. They are much more comfortable than a normal pad, it doesn't really move once in position but if it does its easy to adjust it. Not like normal pads where if you put it in the wrong place its hard to adjust it after and feels like wearing a nappy. This just feels like sitting on a cloud. Not sure if this particular make do already but would be great if they had different colours for females living in the same house doing washing together.

Review Text: I truly love these. I was apprehensive at first. This is my 2nd cycle using them and they're so comfy. I don't get aggravated in bed anymore cos of itchy pads or tampons messing up my ph and making sore. These reusable pads just feel like soft underwear I love them. BUT, they are starting to get a little smell to them, and this is only my 2nd month wearing em. I know it says to rinse on cold, but I put them on 40 wash, with antibacterial wash, and they smell better after that. I aired them too after drying them in tumble dryer, then lay flat on my bedroom windowsill with window open. The 40 wash didn't damage them or anything. Sometimes you need hot water to kill the musty smells you get me. Happy vagina 👍

Review Text: I was having to change my premium brand disposable maxi pads every hour on my heaviest days resulting me using over 10 a day. Not good really, I decided to try some reusable pads to go with my branded reusable period pants (as changing whole pants can be annoying in the day) and settled on these after seeing a customer review on youtube.These dont give as much absorbency as I was hoping, however they last an hour longer than the maxi disposables, so for me that is a win!I have bought two packs of these to keep me going through my heavy days. They can take a while to dry (though not as long as my super heavy flow period pants) and its best to rinse them out then soak then in water until you come to washing them with your usual laundry. This way they dont stain or start to smell due to being left wet for too long.

Review Text: When the pack description said heavy/ maternity I was cautiously optimistic, I purchased my first pack at the end of Jan to test out, and they have been washed multiple times I found them to be comfortable and feel confident wearing no accidents and no unpleasentness/soreness to deal with as you find with disposable I have a few others from a different brand for a daily option, but these are what I would use along with cup when the event shows up depending on the heaviness/activity planned for the day. Would I recommend absolutely have I just received two more packs yes. May not be 100% plastic free but a heck of a lot better for you and the environment than disposable options, and these can be recycled at the end of there life. And to deal with micro plastic issues a guppy friend washing bag/ washing machine filter is always an option. Most clothes contain some type of synthetic materials.

Review Text: So my first time using these I'm fed up of throwing money in the bin (i know there not much), ruining knickers where the normal pads super stick & rip them & I'm getting a bit more eco friendly. (I'm middle of period when starting these to test from normal pads) instructions easy except for the under side has the logo but doesn't state if back or front but I prefer back but I dont think there is a right or wrong. So I liked the dark colour underneath which feels soft & silky like a swim suit material. The pad (extra long) is thicker than my usual pad but you dont notice it. They have 2 poppers to select the width of your panties which is good (big girl). The pad fabric is soft, like a thin sheepskin blanket. It comes with a 2 pocket bag so one fresh one used. I have not had any smell until I decided to wipe the pad which then it did. I do feel fresh & forget I've got it on. They can slide a little but not enough for concern. I've cleaned them by rinsing in cold water until the water runs clear this is when you realise how much fluid the pad has held/soaked up. I put them on the air to dry.in final picture you can see they dry great back to normal.You can put in machine on cold wash, no detergent & dryer on low heat. On my first 2 days I went through 15 pads then 2 eco pads a day. I wish i knew about these a long time ago.

Review Text: I've actually just ordered a second set. I bought my first set 10/11 months ago. I love them. So much more comfortable than disposable ones and more absorbent. They don't need changed as often as disposable ones too. Easy to wash, I just put them in the washing machine and then dry them on the rack or on the radiator. The ones I bought originally are still perfect I just wanted more as sometimes I'm waiting for one to dry after being washed before I can change it. It's worth the money. They stay out very well too. I had other reusable ones that had trouble staying in one place but these ones are fine!

Review Text: Overall I really like these pads. I have heavy flow and the absorbency is amazing and had zero leaks. They are also very comfortable as the liquid gets wicked away from skin. However, they can slide around in my pants and I need to readjust them regularly, so I tend to use them at home rather than at work or when out and about. The heavy flow pads are fairly bulky but no worse than standard maxi pads really. Don't know how they will feel in warm weather as the fabric is thick and like fleece, so they may be a bit warm in a heat wave. Very easy to wash and found the waterproof bag very useful. Overall, I am satisfied and will probably get some more in the future

Review Text: These are an absolute god send! If you ever get itchy or leak with disposable pads, please give these a try! I bleed heavily and was forever leaking even with a night-time disposable pad and it would still go everywhere. Now I just use one of these Mediums, with some period underwear and no more spills. I think the fuzzy material stops it from shifting too much compared to other pads, so it stays and catches what it needs to.Washing them out is a breeze, just rinse them under cold water and toss them in the washer. I've only used them for 2 cycles and I no longer have any irritation, or sweating either.They're also super comfortable on, not bulky or makes you feel as if you're wearing a pad at all.10/10

Review Text: I've found that I really quite like these after initially being dubious and will definitely see what other products are in the range.Pros:Very absorbent, soft and comfortableThe popper fastens well under your knickers and they stay secureEasy to clean by hand and then wash in the machineThese can be fastened up like little parcels when dirty/wet and stored in a provided bag before putting in the washCons:A pack of 3 large and 3 medium wasn't enough for one period without washing several times. This was my first but so will definitely buy moreThese are slimline but still a little bulkier than I would like for leggings, tighter fitting trousers. I'm working from home at the moment so this isn't really an issueIt's not an issue as such but where these are made from fabric, they absorb quite a lot and it's a bit tricky to tell how heavy you are bleeding until you rinse them out. Just something I need to get used to I suppose.

I'm working from home at the moment so this isn't really an issueIt's not an issue as such but where these are made from fabric, they absorb quite a lot and it's a bit tricky to tell how heavy you are bleeding until you rinse them out. Just something I need to get used to I suppose.

Review Text: I bought these after years of using tampons and disposable pads. A couple of years ago I switched to a mooncup (great too!) but found that inserting a mooncup (or tampons) at the beginning of my period would cause my cramps to worsen. So I decided to give these a try.They are BRILLIANT. Unless I am going for a run, I will use these over any other menstrual item. It's like a soft haven for your lady parts. A cosy time for your foof. Your lady garden doesn't get stuck in the adhesive because there is none. You don't crinkle when you walk. BYE BYE ADULT LADY NAPPY RASH.If wearing at night, make sure you button them up on the tighter button if you can - they can move around a bit if you're a mover, but to be honest, they are still more reliable than disposables!I bought a pack of heavy ones, and I hand wash them (I only have 6 and I am not organised enough to wash them in the machine mid cycle lol) and they are literally incredible. Cannot recommend highly enough.
Product Name: Eco Lily Reusable Sanitary Pads (6Pk for Heavy Flow)

Review Text: These are soo comfy and I've had no problems with them moving around. The extra long ones are great for nights as they prevent any leakages. The grey side which I believe is the side you use is a nice fleece material so is very soft and doesn't cause any rubbing.They have a great absorbency as I have always experienced heavy flows and normally go through 5 pads in the day and 2-3 during the night. However I only need to use one of these during the day and one of the longer ones at night time.When washing I leave them to soak in cold salted water to prevent staining for about an hour then just put them on the 30 minute 30 degrees Celsius setting, I don't use any conditioner/softener as this can affect the absorbency of the pads. And then I just hang them to dry as I don't think you're supposed to tumble dry these.They're amazing and I only wish I bought them sooner, I will never go back to disposable pads as these are better for the environment and your body without all of the nasty chemicals that can do god knows what to your feminine health. Also I don't have to pay out money for products every month now!
Product Name: Eco Lily Reusable Sanitary Pads (6Pk for 3 Medium + 3 Heavy)

Review Text: I suffer from an extremely heavy menstrual cycle, and usually have to buy the biggest bulkiest incontinence pads to deal with my heavy flow, but lately there have been times the shop hasn't had my towels in stock and I was fed up of wasting money on regular towels that can't handle a period like mine, so I decided to try these. I wasn't expecting much to be honest, but I was shocked at just how much they can absorb and how easy they are to clean. They could do with being a little wider, but apart from that, these towels really are worth the money. Would recommend for any woman who suffers heavy periods.
Product Name: Eco Lily Reusable Sanitary Pads (6Pk for Heavy Flow)

Review Text: This pack of 6 lasted me from the afternoon of day 1 to the evening of day 2, which is about the same as disposables for me. The fleecy upper material is soft and very comfortable, and I didn't find them bulky at all. Absorbency seems good, but perhaps not as quick to wick away wetness. I did notice a slight smell, I suspect the chemicals in disposable pads usually control this. No problems with leaking or moving.I used these 6 pads, then switched back to disposables whilst I set about washing them. I put them in a plastic bathroom bin and rinsed with cold water. I'm not squeamish but I did found this a little unpleasant. Then in the washing machine on 40 degrees for an hour, with normal detergent. They air dry quickly. I put them in with the bath mat, I didn't fancy mixing with clothes.On the whole a positive experience. I will give another cycle's trial before I purchase another set of 6. Main negatives for me are the rinsing (I may try skipping this step), smell (natural but slightly unpleasant) and not being able to monitor how much I'm bleeding (difficult to see or tell).
Product Name: Eco Lily Reusable Sanitary Pads (6Pk for Heavy Flow)

Review Text: I buy these for my daughter to use as night-time sanitary protection during menstruation, as a standard pad would leak everywhere or require her to change 2-3 times during the night. They're absorbant and do the job, allowing her to rest and saving her pyjamas from staining! But they're extremely bulky and I'm not sure how discreet they'd be for daily wear under trousers.

Review Text: My usual fantastic/eco pads were unavailable so thought I'd get these to tide me over. I use lots of amazon brand stuff and am very happy with it. However I'd imagine these to be size/shape of an always medium/large incontinence pad. They arrived - HUGE!! The type you'd use for elderly people 😳!! Or I admit the type I needed about 6 months ago when i was practically in nappies due to menopausal incontinence... but now having gotten about 90% of my bladder control back and for the first time in about 3 years being able to safely wear jeans again these were not what I needed. However all this said they are remarkably comfortable and bizarrely despite the size can be worn with jeans without getting rucked up or being visible!! So actually despite first impressions suprisingly good!

Review Text: These are very big in depth and width so not as comfortable as they might be.The fluid doesn't seem to wick away so they need changing more often as it's lying on the surface which can cause sore skin etc. They do hold quite a lot of liquid.I'm puzzled by someone complaining that they don't stick well as I've found the opposite to be true. In fact they are stuck so firmly that they tend to tear as they are being pulled away releasing white fibres into the air which is unpleasant. I wouldn't want to breath that in.They are cheap, and okay to use if you're hanging around the house, so I'll keep using them till they're gone, but I wouldn't repurchase.I don't know why they have put 'menstrual pads' in the details. That's not what these are for. I suspect someone thinks they are the same because they look the same. That's not how it works.

Review Text: Let me tell you about my experience with Amazon Basic Care Incontinence Pads Extra Plus. These pads aren't just for leaks---they're multi-purpose wonders!First off, let's talk about absorbency. These pads soak up liquids like a sponge on steroids. Whether it's a little dribble or a full-blown gush, these pads have got you covered. And let's not forget about their versatility. Need to mop up a spill? No problem. These pads can handle it all, from kitchen mishaps to bathroom emergencies.But wait, there's more! These pads aren't just for practical use---they're also a fashion statement. Who needs designer handbags when you can sport a stylish pad under your clothes? With their discreet design and comfy fit, you'll be strutting your stuff with confidence, knowing you're protected from any unexpected leaks.And let's not forget the entertainment value. Need a makeshift frisbee for some impromptu outdoor fun? Look no further than these bad boys. Just toss 'em in the air and watch them soar. Who knew incontinence pads could double as entertainment?In conclusion, Amazon Basic Care Incontinence Pads Extra Plus are more than just absorbent---they're practical, versatile, and downright entertaining. Five stars for these multi-purpose marvels!
Product Name: by Amazon Incontinence Pads Extra Plus, 48 Pads (6 Packs of 8), Individually wrapped, Unscented (Previously Amazon Basic Care) - Packaging May Vary

Review Text: I have just started using these pads. They are cheaper than what I had been using. I found them comfortable & soft larger in size to what I had been use to but overcome the size they are adequate for night time wear. Stays in place & there is no un pleasant smells which some pads can have due to their make up. Would recommend but perhaps like me I tried a few before ordering on a regular basis. I ordered X pads because they had been reduce for a while so I order extra Just ordered extra package I am pleased with these pads comfortable with item. My regular monthly subscription well worth the money. Using these pads I find helps me especially @ night & always I take more with me when on holiday & visiting friends therefore sometimes I need to order more but am really surprise that they have been going up in price regularly item that many people need when they are advertised as basic. Still buying these items on a regular basis just in case needed in an emergency. Still using items very comfortable with them now. Delivered this morning via RM helpful driver still using these pads although having gone up in price but am now comfortable with pads so will continue

Review Text: Very comfortable to wear and no causes no irritation at all as this is not a fragranced product ~ thankfully. It manages to stay in place perfectly despite not having wings and is much more capable of holding pee than the usual brands are.Occasionally these do not manage to contain my full on accidents which then means either underwear change (underneath the pad gets damp if it is too much) or it is a full on trouser change. However, that would be impossible for any pad to manage to do but just wanted it to be known that if full on accidents are the main issue, then the other Amazon product which I also use would be a huge help. That is the Amazon "adult pull up" as I call them to my kids who also happen to be in pull ups to try to help them understand.These also work great if you happen to have heavy periods due to the nature of the product.These are excellent value for money and is significantly less than the so called leading brands. It is already very pricey having bladder issues so expensive pads on top is definitely not something that is needed!These would be ideal for people who happen to have leaks as I am unable to feel I need to go until seconds before I do and these can contain that if it isn't say, an early morning pee or a pee after drinking a lot of water, for example.The products arrive in a plain box which is impossible to tell what is inside. That is very well thought-out as most people don't want it made obvious that they are have bladder issues.These are not obvious under clothes either.
Product Name: by Amazon Incontinence Pads Extra Plus, 48 Pads (6 Packs of 8), Individually wrapped, Unscented (Previously Amazon Basic Care) - Packaging May Vary

So I will be keeping my eyes open for something that fits the bill in all senses.

Review Text: It's my first time ti use Amazon Basics incontinence pads and I'm really impressed. They're very comfortable to wear, stay secure throughout the day, and offer excellent absorbency --- I never feel worried about leaks. The pad fits well, stays discreet under clothing, and doesn't smell even after long use.Value for money is great compared to well-know and expensive brands, and I've found the quality to be just as good (if not better). Highly recommend these pads to anyone looking for comfortable, dependable protection at a reasonable price!I was looking for huge and long pads for my incontince (accidents) when I coughed alot especially when I have flu. This saved me!
Product Name: by Amazon Incontinence Pads Extra Plus, 48 Pads (6 Packs of 8), Individually wrapped, Unscented (Previously Amazon Basic Care) - Packaging May Vary

Review Text: 4.5 stars, rounded up to 5. These are decent quality pads, which I used to supplement my usual brand (Tena). The pads are described as maximum absorption, and they do cope well with moderate amounts.They are slightly shorter than Tena pads, but the adhesive strip is longer. Not suitable for overnight use, unless used as a liner for a large non-adhesive shaped pad, which is how I use them.These pads are quite bulky - definitely not the same as an ultra-thin pad. Reasonable value. One plus point, each pad is individually wrapped in a thin plastic pouch. These wrappers are useful for disposing of used pads discreetly.
Product Name: by Amazon Incontinence Pads Extra Plus, 48 Pads (6 Packs of 8), Individually wrapped, Unscented (Previously Amazon Basic Care) - Packaging May Vary

Review Text: Got these for my elderly Gran who is on diuretics so needs pads. She previously bought hers from Asda but they didn't have any in stock so thought we'd try these out.She rates them much higher than the Asda ones, and also the main brands. She said they're by far the best pads she has tried - they absorb a lot, she said they're longer than the others and they don't fall off. She is only using 1 of these a day while she had to use 2 of the other brands per day.Also ideal for someone housebound like her as we can order them direct to her quickly and without worry of them being out of stock.Really pleased that we tried these, it's the small things that can make her life a little bit better, and these have clearly exceeded her expectations!
Product Name: by Amazon Incontinence Pads Extra Plus, 48 Pads (6 Packs of 8), Individually wrapped, Unscented (Previously Amazon Basic Care) - Packaging May Vary

Review Text: Have received Amazon Incontinence Pads MAXI,absorbency Rated 7, for many months on a Subscribe and Save Order. Last order, same quality product expected. NO. DISAPPOINTING.Amazon, please review and restore to previous quality standard.
